info.title: Expense Report Service
info.description: Expense Report Service (ERS) is the next-generation v4 API for operations related to creating and processing Expense Reports. In order to interact with this API, a client must include either an authorized User or Company JWT in the header of each request, or use an X.509 client certificate with a CN included in the Allowed List by the ERS team.

stepInstances.description: Steps in the workflow instance. All existing workflow steps must be passed in the correct order, even if they're not being updated. If a step is being added or deleted, the sequence order of the existing steps following the added step must be adjusted accordingly

stepId.description: Identifier of the step that this is an instance of. If this is a user added step, this must be equal to the step id of the corresponding workflow's user added step identifier

sequenceOrder.description: Sequence of this step in the workflow

isUserAdded.description: Boolean indicating if this step should be added to the workflow

isDeleted.description: Boolean indicating if this step should be deleted

stepInstanceId.description: Step instance identifier, must be null for a user added step

subWorkflowInstances.description: List of sub workflow instances, for example, cost object workflows

UpdateWorkflowStepInstance.description: Steps in the workflow instance. All existing workflow steps must be passed in the correct order, even if they're not being updated. If a step is being added or deleted, the sequence order of the existing steps following the added step must be adjusted accordingly

exceptionVisibility.description: The visibility of the exception to be added. Possible values: 'ALL' - The exception is visible to the Traveler, Approver, and Processor, 'APPROVER_PROCESSOR' - The exception is visible only to the Approver and Processor, 'PROCESSOR' - The exception is visible only to the Processor. Default value: ALL
